results.title: Sir Alec Guinness Ealing comedy: Kind hearts and coronets; The Man in the white suit; The Lavender Hill mob; The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Charles Crichton, Robert Hamer and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Four features starring Sir Alec Guinness produced by the revered Ealing studio. In “The Ladykillers” Guinness guides a gang of misfits through a daring robbery only to be foiled by their seemingly harmless, elderly landlady. Set in Edwardian England, “Kind hearts and coronets” sees Guinness play eight parts - all victims of a serial killer, determined to claim his birthright. A satire on industry and commerce “The Man in the white suit” features Guinness as a would-be chemist who develops an indestructible fabric. Guinness plays a timid bank clerk who has the perfect scheme for stealing gold bullion from the Bank of England in “The Lavender Hill mob”. These four comedies highlight Guinness’ unerring talent for satire and farce. Also available on VHS “The Lavender Hill Mob” [302796], “Kind Hearts and coronets” [302542], “The Ladykillers” [304307], “The Man in the white suit” [507924].

results.title: Sintu
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Two dancers entwine and dance to the music of Third Eye. The mix of animation with live action creates a sense of emotional or felt response to the musicical soundtrack. A kaleidescope of colours.

results.title: Sins of the father and of the son
results.creator_credit: Harry Hook, Jackie Johnstone and National Film School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Starring Jonathan Dockar-Drysdale, Hilary Hook, Camille Davies, Gigi Soames. Tells of a young man’s journey to see his estranged father, a retired Army Colonel living on an island in the Indian Ocean where he studies Islamic culture. The strangeness of the culture and the surroundings lead to a break in the father and son’s relationship.

results.title: Sink or swim
results.creator_credit: Gwynneth Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Gwynneth Cole joined the army in 1944, roles for women were limited. While Cole didn’t get to serve on the front line, she was posted to different bases in Australia as a nurse and faced many hardships and the realities of war. Cole greatly values her time in the army and reflects on the opportunities for women and the independent streak she has passed on to her four daughters.

results.title: Singlehanders
results.creator_credit: Shelagh Mackenzie, Kent Nason and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Alone on the open sea! Two Canadians, Bob Lush and Mike Birch, took cameras aboard their yachts during the 1980 Observer Singlehanded Transatlantic Race. The result is more than a record of this prestigious international sailing event. The sport of ocean racing becomes the starting point for an epic of challenge and determination.

results.title: Single sculling techniques
results.creator_credit: Michael Johns, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
Slow motion and freeze-frame photography is used to demonstrate common faults in sculling techniques, and showing the correct techniques. Excellent film with very good commentary.

results.title: Single file
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the problems concerned when a file is misplaced in an office situation - intended as training for public service employees, but is applicable in any office. Shows the worry and concern caused by inefficient methods of work, clutter, lack of interest and poor organisation in loaning, distributing and return of files.

results.title: Single-phase and polyphase circuits
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
A training film explaining a single-phase synchronous generator; the use of sine curves to illustrate flow change; a two-phase system and three-phase system and ways to simplify wiring.
